Title: A Tale of Two Detectives Ep.3
SubTitle: No Translation

Text:
The next day, after morning lessons are over, Cid is
already at their meetup spot.

Oh, good... I guess I was overthinking things
yesterday.
What happened?

Th-Thank you for going out with me again today! Ack!
I meant, go out with me to investigate! I didn't mean
it in a weird way!
Hmmm...
Cid? Is something wrong?
Nope. It's nothing.

Really? Well, let's get down to business. I brought
a lot of things with me today.
Besides sandwiches?
I also baked some cookies!
And the sandwiches are bigger than yesterday, too.

You ate a lot yesterday, remember, Cid? So I thought
I should give them a bit more substance.

Ah, so that's why you made chicken sandwiches. They
look good.
Heehee, I'm glad you like them.

Now, you can go ahead and eat, but I want you to look
at this.
A paper bag?

The paper bag on the table is filled with all
sorts of items Sherry has packed for the
day's investigation.

After we parted ways yesterday, I did some thinking
alone. I asked myself what I was missing in my
strategy to find the culprit.

I did a lot of thinking, and I reread the first
volume of the Girllock Holmes series...and
then I noticed something.
This is what I'm missing!
A magnifying glass?
Oh, that's not all! Ta-dah!
A pipe...

It's a fake pipe. I can't exactly walk around the
school smoking a real pipe.
Yeah, I guess not.
I also brought this!
A detective hat...

I was considering getting a coat with the same motif,
but it was too difficult to get by today...

Too bad, if I had the coat, I could get my appearance
much closer to Girllock Holmes. Now my look is rather
lopsided.
Nah, I think it's a good thing you don't have it.
Oh, it is not a good thing...

She puffs out her cheeks indignantly. That is just
how determined she's been to get that coat.

If I dressed the same as Girllock Holmes, I thought
I'd have a sudden breakthrough and solve the case
in a flash...

I know I said that reality is nothing like a book...
But I thought that if I tried to look the part, things
might be different this time!
Yeahhh...maybe you're right.

Hmmm... Do you think maybe I really should drop
everything and go look for the coat right now?
Cid...is something the matter?
It's just...
You seem excited.
Huh?
Are you enjoying this?
E-Enjoying this?! Well, I...

(I must catch whoever sent that letter, at any cost!
How could I possibly be...excited... Well, maybe I'm
just a little...excited?)
I see...

Cid...were you just thinking that I'm not taking this
seriously enough?

That I'm silly for playing detective and getting
excited when I have no clue of who sent the
letter or why... And you're fed up with me?
I'm not fed up with you.
You mean it...?
Of course.

Ohh...what a relief. I didn't know what I would do if
you were fed up with me...

Though it would partly have been my fault for acting
in a way that would make you draw the wrong
conclusions.

Huh? So, wait, does this mean you were acting excited
on purpose?
Urk...yes, I was.

Sherry can't hide anything from Cid. But the reason
she is acting excited is to keep her jitters from
getting the better of her.

Whenever I'm alone...or when I'm thinking about the
culprit...there are brief moments...where I feel very
anxious.

I wonder...if I can't catch the culprit... What if
they do more horrible things to me...

If you and I couldn't be friends anymore, Cid, I
would just...!

(I thought if I pretended to be Girllock Holmes,
I could forget about my worries...)
I get it... I really do get it.

Whenever you're feeling anxious, if you become
someone you admire and say their catchphrases
without a shred of embarrassment, it is really
empowering.
Huh?! W-Well... Yes, I suppose that is true...
Why're you fidgeting?

W-Well, because...I've always wanted to have
experiences like the heroine in a story... It's
just that this was a good opportunity for me
to follow through on it...

Wait a minute...is this actually just a special
interest of yours? All that stuff about being
anxious was just to explain it after the fact?

Yes... Oh! No! But! I really do want to find the
culprit! I would never do something like this
just for the fun of it!

Well...yeah. If doing something like this cheers you
up, I don't see anything wrong with it.

Cid begins to eat his sandwich. As she watches him
eat, Sherry thinks to herself...

(Cid...the truth is, Girllock Holmes has a partner.
And her partner is kind of aloof and doesn't
seem to care at all about her cases...)

(But whenever she's stumped during a case, her
partner will always give her some hints vital to
solving the case...)

(That's why Girllock Holmes trusts her partner
more than anyone else. And to me, Cid, you
are the world's greatest partner...)
Hm? What's wrong?
Eep?! Wha... Wh-Wh-What is it?!

You seemed like you were getting lost in your
thoughts.

Heehee! Oh, nothing's wrong. Oh! Look! You've got
mustard on your cheek.
Mustard... Oh, you're right.
Oh! You mustn't wipe it with your finger. Use this.

A handkerchief? Nah, I'm good. I don't want to get it
dirty. I'll just wipe it on my sleeve.

Oh no you don't. That will just make your uniform
dirty.

You have a point. Okay, I guess I'll use that
handkerchief.

And as the two of them sit peacefully and eat their
sandwiches together, it is hard to believe that they
are right in the middle of an investigation.

Okay, so back on topic. Besides gathering a bunch of
detective stuff, did you get any good ideas?

Well, yes. I presumed that...a second letter would
probably come soon.

That's hard to refute, yeah. In fact, us hanging out
as usual is probably provoking the culprit since
they didn't want us to be friends.
Oh! Yes...that must be true.

But if I do receive a second letter, it might contain
another clue for me. That sort of thing always
happens to Girllock Holmes, too.

Whenever you're stuck and need another lead, it's
always most effective to wait for the culprit to strike
again. You know that sayingsometimes you must
lose the battle to win the war!
That's what it means, right?
Well, yeah, I guess so.

Though I don't think they'd do something today, just
after they acted yesterday.
Oh... Yes, you're right...
She can't help but despair in feeling stuck.

Which means, all we can do until the culprit strikes
again is...

I don't think you could honestly say there's nothing
we can do. Will you show me that letter again?
Oh! Sure. Here it is.

But I already reread the letter many times and didn't
find any clues...
Oh, I know this stationery. It's only sold at school.
What?! How did you know that?!

I just noticed it now that I've got a second look at
it. See the school crest watermark in the corner?

You're right... I was so caught up in the words of
the letter itself that I'd let something important
go unnoticed.

Whoa, wait a minute! If this stationery can only be
bought at school, then that means...!

We could just go talk to the people who work at the
store that sells it!
Exactly. But before we do that...
Huh...?

Cid takes her hand and starts to run. Her heart
pounds hard for a moment.
(Cid and I...are holding hands?!)
This way.
Cid?!
(Wh-Whaaat? Cid?! Aren't you being a bit too bold?!)
